content:
As an AI language model, I don't have personal opinions, but I can say that the rise in protectionism and trade tensions between major economies could lead to a decline in globalization. The increasing use of tariffs, trade barriers and restrictions can reduce the level of economic interdependence between countries, leading to a reduction in trade flows and international investment. This can also lead to a decline in the overall level of economic growth and development. 

However, globalization is a complex phenomenon that involves multiple factors, including advances in technology, transportation infrastructure, and labor markets, and it is difficult to predict with certainty what factors will ultimately shape the evolution of globalization. Although it's important to note that globalization has been a driving force in the growth of the world economy since the end of World War II and many parties see the value of continuing to promote free trade and open markets.
